job_title: Assistant Manager Group Quality Assurance - Ground
description:
Reports to: Group Quality Assurance Manager - Ground
Department: Group Safety & Operation Risk Mgt (GSR)

Role Introduction


Responsible for supporting, administering, implementing and maintaining an effective quality assurance program across the ground operations departments of Cathay Pacific Airways and with relevant suppliers of operational services.
Support the Ground Quality Team to ensure the audit programs are maintained and monitored for effective delivery.
Key Responsibilities


Support the delivery of an effective, efficient risk-based quality assurance program for Cathay Pacific by:

Preparing the annual Consolidated Port Audit Program Schedule, maintaining and updating the audit program checklists, information package and audit report template
Consolidating and producing a master internal/supplier audit plan and reviewing it with GQMs regularly to maintain robust records of any changes and cancellations
Assisting the GQAMG in preparation of the ISARP matrix, yearly schedule, checklist creation etc
Assisting the GQAMG with the biennial IATA Operational Safety Audit. This includes the ownership and assessment of operational activities against relevant ISARPs, briefings of ground operations teams, production of the conformance report for CGO & GRH disciplines
Assisting with logistical support for the IOSA and annual external audit of GSORM
Monitoring all audit program schedules, status, sending a survey to auditees after audit completion, report preparation and sign off process, including report follow-up with GQM and HGQ
Maintaining the dashboard of the audit programs
Managing the new joiner learning path, inclusive of preparing and delivering the Provisional Auditor briefing kit, onsite familiarization and recurrent training package for all applicable audit programs, and ensuring the completeness of the training records of all certified auditors
Performing duties of a Lead Auditor and/or Auditor in all applicable audit programs
Assisting the GQAMG with Continuous Monitoring Inspection Checklist management, i-Auditor system management and oversight of contracted supplier and (Safety Culture)
Assisting HGQ to prepare the annual Air Safety Review Committee and Management Review presentations
Providing valuable input to different safety groups i.e. JSWG, RSWG and LCGW.
Assisting with internal quality educational/training programs to promote quality systems awareness throughout the company
Preparing, updating and managing the Quality Briefings and Quality Deliverables reporting to all relevant senior management
Assisting HGQ in coordination and record keeping of the Quality Meeting, agenda preparation, annual kick-off meeting, and special purpose meetings, coordination of presenters and contributors and meeting record keeping
Assisting in the preparation and maintenance of all Air Operator Certificate documentation and communication with HKCAD
Maintaining, and ensuring the regular review by senior management of the Operations and Management Services Agreements and associated appendices between CPA, AHK and HKE
Maintaining the GSORM Quality Internal SharePoint site and ensuring site managers update and maintain content for ‘The Hub’ (intranet) page of GSORM Quality

Audit Database

Maintain, support, and update the audit database to ensure that it is accurate at all times
Consolidate and analyse audit database user feedback to provide to the database supplier (Rolls-Royce)
Assist to conduct User Acceptance Test for upgrades to the audit database

General Tasks

Assist the GQMG and GQAMG to manage the ground quality team.
Represent the Company and/or Department at relevant meetings in a professional and loyal manner
Assist in the response to a crisis involving Cathay Pacific as a member of the Care Team
Develop and maintain an effective relationship with the Group Quality team, extended team members, and ground operations departments, including participation in departmental management meetings
Provide input to HGQ in relation to budgeting for Consolidated Port Audits and related matters
Deputize for the GQAMG as required
Extensive duty travel required
Requirements


Education qualifications

HKDSE: Minimum Level 2 or equivalent in 5 NSS subjects including English, or HKCEE: Minimum Grade E in 5 HKCEE subjects (Including level 2 or above in English Language).
Tertiary education or equivalent.

Professional qualifications

Lead Auditor qualifications.
Dangerous Goods Awareness.

 Experiences

3-5 years operational experience in the airline industry, preferably in either Engineering, Flight Operations, Inflight Services, Ground Operations, or Cargo Operations.
1-3 years in a management or supervisory role.
Adequate and appropriate auditing or quality systems experience.

Job related knowledge

Understanding of airline ground, cargo and flight operations.
Care Team training.

Skills and language requirements

Excellent command of both spoken and written English.
Interpersonal and communication skills.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
Data- and process-literate.
Computer literate - Microsoft Office.
Application deadline: 27 January 2022



Cathay Pacific is an Equal Opportunities Employer. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with our personal data policy and for recruitment purposes only. Candidates not notified within eight weeks may consider their application unsuccessful. All related information will be kept in our file for up to 24 months. description:
Technical Officer of Civil Aviation Engineering (Air Traffic Control Systems Operation and Maintenance / Project)

The Job:

Department of Travel and Transportation is looking for Technical Officer(s) in following Civil Aviation Engineering teams:

 Air Traffic Control Systems Operation and Maintenance Team

Assist in performing technical operations, maintenance/repair for air traffic control (ATC), airport related systems or electronic/communication/IT equipment/systems and its ancillary support facilities
Assist in planning, organizing, supervising and/or directly carrying out maintenance/repair works of systems/equipment and conducting system review to ensure system reliability and availability
Assist in or directly and dependently carrying out equipment preventive/corrective maintenance, on-site equipment installation, testing and commissioning, fault diagnosis and repair according to a rectification plan/solution as well as helping one’s supervisor in preparing fault/problem investigation report and/or procurement plan for spare parts or maintenance/repair services
Assist in coordination with various internal and external parties such as various government departments, local or overseas airport authority, vendors/suppliers, sub-contractors and so on for operations and maintenance works

 Project Team

Assist in performing project work for air traffic control (ATC), airport related systems or electronic/communication/IT equipment/systems and its ancillary support facilities
Assist in preparing solution for project tender bidding and implementation of project including drafting design submission, requirements for materials/service procurement, supervision/monitoring of sub-contractors installation works, preparation of test plan/report, conduct testing and commissioning
Assist in project progress monitoring, financial monitoring and control of projects to ensure satisfactory completion of project within budget and schedule and help one’s supervisor to prepare project/works progress reports for submission or logistics support
Assist in coordination with various internal and external parties such as various government departments, local or overseas airport authority, vendors/suppliers, sub-contractors and so on for operations and maintenance works

Team allocation is based on qualifications, experience and personal attributes of the appointee.

The Person

Certificate or above in Electronics/Electrical/Telecommunication/Computer/ Software/Information/e-logistics/Industrial Engineering or other related disciplines
Possession of training record of Air Traffic Safety Electronic Personnel/Professional (ATSEP) training course is an advantage
Possessing track record of relevant hands-on working experience in system design, building, testing and commissioning, operations and maintenance in mission critical service or project is highly preferable
Good team player, customer-focused mindset, open-mindedness, proactive, result/service oriented, total quality management and safety concept with strong logical analytical, communication and interpersonal skills
Able to work independently under pressure with strong desire and commitment to deliver high quality of works in short notice
Good spoken and written English is a must. Knowledge of Putonghua is preferred
Fresh graduates will also be considered
Possessing driving license is an advantage
May work in shift duty and/or irregular hours including overnight, Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays and/or outdoor as required
